key_changes: Added equipment_templates to the import statement from app.api.v1
Registered equipment_templates router with include_router() call
file_insights.impact: Router registration for new equipment_templates endpoint

patterns_discovered.description: Consistent pattern of importing router modules and registering them with include_router() with appropriate prefixes and tags
All router modules imported in a single line, alphabetically ordered for maintainability
Router tags match the module name in kebab-case (equipment_templates maps to tags=["equipment_templates"])

gotchas_discovered.description: equipment_templates was inserted in alphabetical order in the import statement, maintaining consistency with existing patterns
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Follow alphabetical ordering when adding new router imports

gotchas_discovered.description: Router module must be imported before it can be registered with include_router()
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Ensure import statement is updated whenever adding new router registrations

approach_outcome.description: Successfully registered the equipment_templates router in the API v1 router configuration
steps_completed: Registered router with include_router() after equipment router
Applied consistent tagging and naming conventions

recommendations.recommendation: Maintain alphabetical ordering in import statements for consistency and easier maintenance
When adding new routers, verify the corresponding module file exists in app.api.v1 before registering
Document the router registration pattern and tag naming conventions for future developers
Add integration tests to verify all registered routers are accessible at their designated endpoints
